comment: On first taste, I thought it was a little strong - but I quickly gained appreciation. Seriously nice smell and texture. 110 proof
Great aroma! Nice texture smooth. Finishes well. Great to share!
Nice taste. Not too much rye.  Comfortable and drinkable.
Hot, long burn, simple and straight forward, young
A good young bourdon, hints of light carmel and cashews.  A good strong pleasant finish.  Exceeded  expectations.
This young bourbon made me think of a pleasantly rainy spring day along the river.  Really enjoyed the peaty flavor on the nose and palate. Tried at Bluegrass Tavern in Lex, KY
Nice to sip with a splash of water. Young, yes - but smooth.

This is an excellent bourbon at a great price. Stacks up well to bottles almost twice the price. Deep, complex flavor. Nose is OK. Initial palate is wonderful, strong notes of brown sugar, toasted oak, and a vague sense of leather that's actually quite pleasant. Mid-palate brings deep layers of apricot, fruit, vanilla, and a hint of char. Mild taste of oak tannins.  Long, satisfying finish of fruit, brown sugar, and toasted oak.
Nice and smooth- easy to drink straight. Definitely benefits from a Glencairn glass to help focus aroma and support flavors.
I'd agree with most reviews, young Bourbon. Sweet to start and a long burn at the end. Not a bad drink and price is reasonable.
Nose has some banana and brown sugar maybe a little toffee. Slight burn right off the bat. Oak and tobacco notes, little vanilla. Good bourbon for the price.
Purchased in Lexington Kentucky in June 2013 for approximately $30. Last tasting in the winter of 2013 with Andy Cook at the Greenbrier.
Very flat. Not much to this. Seems like a mixer to me.

I'd just say that it's OK.... nothing exciting but it was worth a try. It would probably make for a decent cocktail whiskey. If you're looking for something around the same price point, give Elmer Lee a try.
Smooth but bland. No wow factor.
Not much else out there like it that I have tried. Not good and not bad. Just meh

Just not that interesting -- now I have a bottle I'll have to drink at some point.  The bourbon expert at Total Wine raved about this -- I should have known better.  Give me Old Grand Dad Bonded any day of the week over this.   Looks like an Elmer T Lee bottle -- not in the same league.
Scent of yogurt covered pretzels and cinnamon dust. Taste is deep in sweet and sour sauce with a tingly finish to match. Nice bourbon to pair with Asian cuisine.
Vanilla and sweet, one rock helps it

Nothing special, sweet, rounds out ,young and hot. 
Next day.......leaves a "note" , hangs with you like rough moonshine. Many others to drink ,will not keep in my cabinet.
Very smooth with slightly hot finish
good balance, light but solid flavor

Tastes like honey roasted peanuts. Sweet up front, some faint wood notes. Short finish. Slightly harsh at the end. Don't let the Elmer-duplicate bottle fool you, but this stands on its own. Maybe overpriced by 5 or 10 dollars. 6/19/17  
    The strong peanut scents remind me of Heaven Hill (perhaps the source of this juice?), which I like, and that's coupled with banana and a bit of char. So this smells like an Elvis Presley sandwich. On the palate, honey roasted peanuts and wood. A bitter aftertaste remains (think pecan shells), and gets stronger as you go. Short finish. Adding some limestone water brought out some vanilla on the nose. I do like this, but again, I would enjoy it a lot more if it were $10 cheaper. 6/21/17
Bought at Groppis Food Mart --- Niccol and Tim recommend this bourbon. Love the initial taste, smooth and creamy with a cinnamon redhots candy like aftertaste.
Minty, sharp, lingering presence. Somewhat simple, with the essence of complexity eagerly hiding in the background.

I find this to be a pretty boring whiskey. There are no offensive flavors that detract from it, but nothing is really positive either. Not worth the single barrel price.

Thin on the mouth, short finish. Meh. 

2.5 stars

At three stars, I feel like I have to lead by stating that this is not a bad bourbon by any means. It's actually quite easy to drink - deceptively smooth for 94 proof, light (almost refreshing, even), with a sweet vanilla and caramel corn profile, lightly dusted with some baking spices. And...that's about it, and that's the issue. Imagine you're out on a date with someone who is nice enough, and kinda cute, even...but has zero personality. Are you going out on a second date? Yeah, me neither. THAT'S this bourbon's fault - it's just kinda nice. You can do worse, but you can also do so much better.

Love this mash bill generally, but you add a bit of water and the profile intensifies in its maltiness. I get buttered popcorn and slight green apple, vanilla, and deep sweet fruit. Better with a few drops of water: less bite, but also less sour oak and leather, letting the salt and bitterness shine through.
Mid burn, smooth finish. Astringent odor
Truly do not understand the current 78 rating.  It's very smooth and tasty.
Soft vanilla nose with a sweet malty oily leather on the tongue. Extremely short oaky finish.
Thin and has a weird flavor. Do not buy
It's not supposed to be good, but I really liked this. Looking forward to trying Medley 12 year.
Not enjoying this bourbon much.   Has a sharp bite to it with a burnt oak flavoring.   See if it grows on me.
Strong flavor but straight forward. Good burn but without a satisfying finish. Little bitter at end.

I like this bourbon. I read the  reviews and you get it tastes like popcorn, banana, fruit, spice, cinnamon, etc.. I don't spend my time analyzing it, I just get my paper, my dog and pour a glass. this hits the spot, easy to drink, good balance of heat and taste.
Pretty smooth with a short bite to finish and a lingering oaky taste.   Hints of vanilla.   Bit too oaky to rate higher.
Nose is coconut to me, finish is sweet. Vanilla and a hint of spice. Dig it

Very nice nose, tons of notes of vanilla and sweet bread. Soft on the palate. Tons of dough come through. Not much barrel character for an eight year statement. Very quick finish. Overall decent but nothing jumps out at me
Very smooth front, slight burn on back. Vanilla
Sweet, wasn’t popular at store in UT, bought on clearance. Well worth the $20 on clearance.
Better with ice - harsh, but a nice finish with ice
Rough and medicinal but does have some spices to it.

Strong ethanol on the nose. Not much else. Surprisingly smoother up front than you’d expect, but that’s about it. Mediocre in the mouth. Finish is spicy/cinnamon, but gone fast. Long, slow burn after.  Not really much in the way of great flavor or experience. A young, under aged bourbon that is non descript. Spend a few dollars more and buy something worth drinking. Good for mixers,  it that’s about it.
Smokey first flavor ending with a caramel not
Epicurean trader barrel is quite good. Strong taste of toffee peanuts.

Barrel 3496, “hand selected by Binny’s” in Chicago. 
Aroma: caramel, vanilla, toffee, cinnamon, light nutmeg, faint alcohol, whips of apricot 
Flavor: First sip, dried apricots, raw oak. Pie crust. Second sip: cinnamon apples, lemon drops, pumpernickel bread. 
Mouthfeel: Pretty darn smooth, just a little rough around the edges. Medium body. Low burn. 
Overall: Quite nice! Especially for the price. A drier bourbon with a fair amount of complexity, albeit subtle. A touch more sweetness could help tie it all together. The initial smoothness gets quite rough by the end of a neat glass.
Ethanol nose. Strong spice but unremarkable.
Very unique and smooth. Heavy on the nutty flavor with a soft and nutty nose.
alcohol on the nose, along with caramel.  Huge vanilla and caramel on the palate, moving to toffee with a medium length finish of home-made praline fudge and a soothing warmth.

I kind of sort of dig this. Spicy nose and on the palate it turns to toasty caramel with a rusty nail flavor. Not so sweet makes this different. Lotta shit going in this bottle. Worth the 50 bones for sure. Just for the quirkiness. Also...BTAC fans will notice that the bottle is exactly the same as the Elmer bottle. I found that very interesting.
Definitely sweet, with some heat felt in the nose. Not much of a burn on the back end. Very smooth. Feels less viscous than other bourbons of this proof.
Very smooth, with just the right bite. Very good bourbon for the price!
High proof with bite. Little cinnamon but smooth
Fantastic smooth bourbon. Easy to sip on and enjoy.
I get a ton of peanut brittle in this.  Decent finish and good mouth-feel.  Not much else though.  6.9/10
Store pick. Smooth all around drinker with a great hazelnut finish

Overpowering ethanol scent upon first pour, still overpowering after 5 minutes. Immature whiskey, sweet almost pecan aftertaste. Suppose you could mix to cover it up but it is terrible. I poured the bottle down the drain.
Sugar aroma, distinct wheat sweetness on the palate
smooth, very easy to drink with a little kick.

I was looking to try another ~$30 small batch but spotted this, and an ABC employee said they just got it in that day. I couldn't exactly remember reviews of this, but I knew it was not a bourbon we normally see in North Carolina so I impulsively picked it up due to the small quantity available. I usually wait to do reviews until I'm almost finished with the bottle but I think my opinion is settled after a few days. 

This is unlike a lot of bourbons I've had recently. It hits you hard with floral oak notes, smelling like it is over 100 proof. It initially is light on the palate but then a strong oak and nut flavor takes over. The finish however lingers with a more spicy dessert flavor mixed with nuts and cloves. To me this is floral, oak, and nutty. It lacks sweetness that many other bourbons have, which could be due to age since the mash bill is similar to many big bourbons I've had recently. If you like more rye/malt influence in your bourbon you may like this a lot. A unique bourbon that is a good change of pace, but not something that I'd consider a good daily sipper.

By the way, adding a little water only dulled the nose and flavor. And I really like the bottle design. It pours easily with no dribbling. And the boxy shape has dimples on the side making it comfortable to grab. More bottles should include dimples.

Barrel information - #4696 and bottled on 05-06-19. I wish they included the cask date, I'm confident it is under 6 years given the taste.
Damn, this was pretty good. Has a nice finish.

Once again....on a road trip to find a bottle of Elmer T.....another false alarm. Drove 40 miles...clerk said:  " false  entry in the STATES  inventory".  Oh...WELL.  ( I never leave a liquor store empty handed).  This time I chose Wathen's single barrel.  The price was $40.00 for  750ml jug.  First...this spirit's proof fights above it's weight.  It has a 100 proof "feel" on the palate.  I found this spirit to have an unusual after taste that I can't associate with other bourbons with a corn heavy mashbill....more of a Scotch taste...Needless to say....NO....I don't know what's in it....but it seemed a bit overbearing.  NOT A DAILY sipper.  Wathen's DOES have a cool decanter....like Elmer T's.  Square bottle with indentations, nice cork/barrel info on the side.  OVERALL...I'd rate this spirit a 3.25 for for a unique flavor and a half star for the decanter. Wathen's HAS been added to my collection....not so much for flavor....but as a simi hard to find spirit with a cool decanter.   CHEERS to ALL!

A very easy sipper. Neat in a glencairn gives me vanilla, woodiness, with a very nutty undertone and finish. Peanuts and the occasional banana will linger. Was recommended this by a bartender when they ran out of Willett pot still. Not a replacement, but definitely added a bottle to my bar after trying.
Very easy to drink but has a bit of a bite.
Smells and tastes like trail mix, with a little bit of cinnamon on the palate. Or oatmeal with rasins. Spicy at first, but then really smooths out. Pretty short finish. Overall, good.
Logan is full of shit!  This stuff is great!  Smooth!!!!

Good bourbon. Quite spicy. Lots of vanilla on the nose and palate. Cherry on the finish. Which is not something I’ve gotten from bourbon before. Cool. 

9 USD per pour
McCormacks Whisky Grill
A lot of vanilla and oak
Sweet nose, slight burn, oaky taste
Solid blend with a peppery finish. Appealing aroma.
Fruity taste and round mouth feel, with a slow but building nice spicy finish. Ends woody with a complex and lasting bourbon taste.
Tropical notes, hints of Vanilla and molasses drinks very smooth for 47%.
Some bite but a great flavor
Wet smooth.  Had it on the rocks.  Glass gifted by Kyle Withers
Floral nose, a bit of an initial burn. Underwhelming flat finish.
Smooth. Less woody than Jack. Not too much burn. I would buy again. 94 proof
A bit of floral on the nose.  Not too complex or much body.  A small burn.
Sweet Carmel notes with a spicy finish

Store pick from Kenny's Liquors (Tampa). 

Light, floral nose with notes of creamed corn and a sweet note I can't quite identify.  It's delicate. Theres a lot going on, but none of it is in your face.  There is a bit of barrel char that wraps sweet notes into a chorus of flavor. 

On the tongue, the profile is similarly delicate with slight white pepper at the beginning, followed by ginger, sasparilla, and creamed corn. There's a hint of honey that leads into a long, silky and warm vanilla finish.

The finish on this bottle is sublime.  Capsacin and black pepper play off honey and vanilla, finally leaving a sweet, oily mouthfeel and deep heat.

Single barrels... every now and then you get a masterpiece. This is one of them.
So much vanilla with this one. Easy drinker but too one note and no finish.
Tastes musty.  Maybe a bad single barrel I got

Wathen's- Barrel: 4697 Bottled: 5-6-19
Pale Golden Straw Color
Nose: Caramel and Coconut combine to give the mild impression of a Caramel Delight Girl Scout Cookie. Some Citrus gives this one a Tropical Vibe. Time in the glencairn yields Oak and Dry Grass along with some Floral Notes. While there is a good amount going on here, everything is light and muted.
Neat: Light and Sweet. The Tropical Vibe continues with Vanilla, Banana, and a surprising amount of Citrus. Light Astringent Oak arrives mid-palate with a little Peppery Spice. Absolutely Zero Kentucky Hug, with Vanilla Sweetness and a little Mint coating the palate.
Splash: A few drops of water brought out a lot of Charred Oak on the nose. Made the palate Spicy and Oaky. Made the Orange Peel way too dominant as well. 
Verdict: I like this one a little less with each pour. Had I rated it from the neck pour it would've been closer to a 4, but after 6 months and a quarter of the bottle down, I just have zero enthusiasm for it. There are some good elements here, but they just don't play well together. It is a Single Barrel Product (so YMMV) but I think that some of the youthful notes that would be smoothed out with a little more time are running the show here.
